title: query.request
description: Request to execute a read-oriented query against a data source (SQL, vector index, API, etc.) with explicit limits, A2A-style channel metadata, optional auth, delegation, and context for multi-agent flows.

x402.description: x402 envelope describing the verb, version, and optional routing metadata.

actor.description: Logical caller (wallet, ENS name, application, or agent identifier).

limits.description: Guardrails for result size, scan size, and latency.

max_rows.description: Maximum number of rows to return.

max_bytes.description: Maximum number of bytes to return in the result set.

max_scan_bytes.description: Optional limit on bytes that may be scanned/read by the engine.

max_latency_ms.description: Optional upper bound on end-to-end latency in milliseconds.

input.description: Data source details and query text or equivalent expression.

source_type.description: Type of data source being queried.

source_uri.description: Logical or physical connection URI/identifier for the source (DSN, connection string, index name, etc.).

query_text.description: Primary query expression (SQL, vector query language, API filter, etc.).

parameters.description: Optional named parameters for the query.

read_only.description: If true, query MUST NOT mutate state; engines SHOULD enforce read-only semantics.

projection.description: Optional list of columns/fields to project in the result.

channel.description: A2A-style channel configuration describing how this request is transported.

input_modalities.description: Modalities used for the request payload.

endpoint.description: Concrete endpoint URI for this invocation (e.g., HTTPS URL, JSON-RPC endpoint).

auth.description: Authentication metadata. Concrete credentials are implementation-specific and MUST NOT be logged in full.

scheme.description: Auth scheme (e.g., none, api_key, oauth2, signed_message).

api_key_id.description: Optional opaque identifier for the API key used.

actor_wallet.description: Optional EVM wallet address associated with this request.

signature.description: Optional detached signature (e.g., EIP-191) proving possession or intent.

delegation.description: Swarm-style delegation policy for multi-agent flows (e.g., handoff to query optimizers, caching layers, or specialized data agents).

allowed.description: Whether the agent is allowed to hand off or delegate this request.

targets.description: Preferred downstream agents (e.g., ENS names or canonical identifiers).

reason.description: Human-readable reason or intent for allowing delegation.

context.description: Optional conversation or workflow context for multi-step or multi-agent interactions.

parent_task_id.description: Identifier of the parent task, if this request is part of a larger workflow.

thread.description: Minimal structured history; format is intentionally implementation-defined.

metadata.description: Non-normative metadata for routing, billing, or analytics. MUST NOT change the core semantics of the request.
